data.title: Blue Mountain Village is Wildly Entertaning
data.meta_description: From entertainment that will blow you away, weekend festivals, live music and family activities there is always something awesome to do at Blue.
data.text:
Live Music: Jesse Murphy Trio

Fri. August 30 | Subaru Stage | 6-9PM

The Jesse Murphy Trio is a musical powerhouse from southern Ontario, Canada! Playing cover songs from the likes of everything from BB King and Little Richard to Prince and Stevie Wonder. JMT has shared stages with such artists as The Trews, Jack de Keyzer and My Son the Hurricane. There is a reason these guys are playing every weekend all spring and summer long so don’t miss your chance to catch them do their thing!

Live Music: Kenny V

Sat. August 31 | Subaru Stage | 1-4PM

2 certified gold records here in Canada, Kenny has also been nominated twice for a JUNO Award in the "Best Instrumental" category for his works, "Fiesta del Sol" and "Mediterranean Nights". He has been playing professionally now for over 20 years and toured the world from Dubai to Bangkok to The West Indies. When you see Kenny perform you will experience a wide range of styles including reggae, soul, blues, pop, rock, latin and calypso.

HEADLINER: The Carpet Frogs

Sat. August 31 | Subaru Stage | 8:30-10PM

A fun party band covering 4 decades of music. The Carpet Frogs are a Toronto-based rock band. They are known for their work performing at private events and touring with Randy Bachman and Burton Cummings and have performed on Canada's Walk of Fame, JUNO Awards, Live 8 Canada, SOCAN Awards, and more.

Live Music: The Justin Kelly Experiment

Sun. September 1 | Subaru Stage | 1-4PM

The Justin Kelly Experiment is a dynamic music group that create, produce and perform all of their own original content. Live off-the-cuff studio sessions and a spontaneous approach to creating music and performing live has been the life blood of this music that you can hardly slot into any specific category. From indie acoustic vibes to rock n' roll and hip hop blends, the consistencies you'll find in their music are meaningful lyrics, real life stories, passionate vocal performances and pure raw energy that resonates both in studio and their live shows!

Family Entertainment: Magic Show

Sun. September 1 | 2-3PM

Sawyer Bullock is an international, award winning speaker and performer. His unique mixture of wit and trickery has garnered him international awards, glowing accolades, and even his own television show. At 24 years old, Sawyer has written for magazines, lectured at universities and high schools, and ran workshops at conferences on the topics of magic, art, ENTREPRENEURSHIP and philosophy.

Live Music: John Muirhead

Sun. September 1 | Subaru Stage | 5-7PM

With stories and songs that kindle late-night Canadian campfires, John Muirhead’s heartfelt indie-folk sound will move you in more ways than one. From fingerpicked folk confessionals to upbeat roots-rock jams, John’s eclectic song collection reflects the highs and lows of love, ambition, and being a young travelling musician. While he is based in London and Halton Hills ON, John is a a troubadour by nature and has played in living rooms, theatres, moving trains, and folk festival stages across Canada.

HEADLINER: Cory Hotline

Sun. September 1 | 8:30-10PM

Cory Hotline is a cosmic collision of funk, pop, rock and disco. Comprised of meticulously selected talent from Toronto’s live music scene, Cory Hotline is a synthesis of retro nostalgia and future-facing funk with the pop sense of Maroon 5 and Michael Jackson. Fresh off a run of successful shows this past year, including a main stage performance at Burlington's Sound Of Music Festival, Cory Hotline is preparing for the release of a brand new album of original music and a series of live performances in 2024.

Live Music: Jeremiah Hill

Mon. September 2 | Subaru Stage | 1-4PM

Jeremiah Hill is a solo acoustic folk rock singer-songwriter and cover artist. He offers a unique take on a wide variety of cover songs rendered in a chilled-out vibe. Twice featured on the iconic Humble & Fred Radio show, he’s been a presence on the North Simcoe music scene since 2015.
